attributes.action: Change the law to Make men eligible for ivf on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Men do not have the same equal opportunities that women have which makes it harder for couples to have a child without paying thousands because a woman has a child already.
It should be made mandatory that men are able to recieve funded ivf on the NHS to enable men to have children too if there is a medical issue which is harder for them to have children naturally.
attributes.background:
Change the law to Give men the same equal opportunities women have for ivf on the NHS if there is underlying problems with fertility on a males side.
Women have that opportunity why do men not recieve the same opportunities to have a child through funded ivf.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  Decisions on when to offer IVF is based on recommendations from NICE and is a decision for individual NHS trusts.
